intro: Ruckeria tagetoides, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
